Hosts.

( Hůrka 1969 , as
My. mystacinus
;
Medvedev et al . 1991
, as

; Polkanov & Medvedev 1997 , as
My. daubentonii
; Farafonova 1999 , as

;

, as

;

, 2015a , 2015b , 2016; Orlova & Kazakov 2016; Farafonova & Gornostaev 2018 , as
My. daubentonii
; this paper),
My. bombinus
(

;

).
Remarks. The record from Turkmenistan by Farafonova & Gornostaev (2018) is doubtful, since it was collected outside the range of the principal host.
